results.title: Building Victoria's 500KV System
results.brief_description: In 1964 when Victoria decided to build the 500KV System to bring power from the LaTrobe Valley to Melbourne, this was the first such system in Australia well before the building started, testing and planning was done.

results.title: Building Evacuation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Runners, floor wardens, chief warden, warning systems, communication systems, Master Emergency Communication Point, assembly areas, mobility impaired people, order of evacuation, when to evacuate…these are just some of the details that need to be considered in the evacuation of a building. Every person in a building needs to know their role in an evacuation. This video addresses the principles of evacuation of any building.

results.title: Building belief. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
This film shows England’s outstanding drama educator, Dorothy Heathcote, working with nine and ten year old American children. She uses drama as a means of teaching social studies. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Building a set
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds, Wesley Greene and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: From the designer’s plans, the carpenter and back stage crew build the set. Drawing an outline on the stage floor (so rehearsals can go on), the crew order material, build flats and complete platforms and other details.

results.title: Building a highway
results.brief_description: A survey of the role of highways in America’s system of transportation and the major processes of roadbuilding including: first surveying, cutting, scraping and levelling of the roadbed; assembling materials; mixing and dumping concrete; smoothing and finishing surface; necessary skills involved to ensure safe, well-built highways.

results.title: Buffaloes for ploughing
results.brief_description: The role of the water-buffalo in improving rice production in Malaya. Shows how a buffalo calf is trained as a farm animal. Its nostrils are pierced at six months and a ring inserted so that it can be led. At two years training is commenced, the buffalo learns how to pull, how to obey signals from his master and finally how to plough. Only patience and practice are needed to produce a thoroughly useful farm buffalo.
